question.name: Question 1
question.text: Can a driver transporting ammunition also carry passengers?
question.correctans: Yes, if a passenger is directly tasked to assist the driver.
question.choices: No, passengers are prohibited.|Yes, if a passenger is directly tasked to assist the driver.|Yes, as long as the ammunition is locked in the trunk of the vehicle.|Yes, there are no restrictions for passengers.

question.name: Question 2
question.text: Rifles and ammunition can be carried in the same POMV as long as both are locked in separate containers.

question.name: Question 3
question.text: Ammunition must be kept in a locked container at all times during transportation.

question.name: Question 4
question.text: The maximum weight of any one package or container of ammunition is:

question.name: Question 5
question.text: Authority for CIC Officers to transport ammunition for CCO activities comes from the Director of Transportation.

question.name: Question 6
question.text: You are tasked to transport the supplies for a weekend activity that includes rifle shooting at a local range. The list of supplies includes:\rPot sets, \rTents,\rRations,\rStoves, lanterns and fuel, and\rBackpacks.\r\rCan you also transport the ammunition in your POMV?

question.name: Question 7
question.text: Drivers of POMV transporting .22 calibre ammunition must:
question.correctans: Possess a valid certificate to transport ammunition.
question.choices: Have a warning sign or placard on the rear left corner of the vehicle.|Only drive during daylight hours.|Possess a valid certificate to transport ammunition.|All of the above.

question.name: Question 8
question.text: In the case of an accident where a POMV transporting ammunition is damaged and can\u2019t be driven, the driver must:
question.correctans: Inform emergency service responders that there is ammunition in the vehicle.
question.choices: Have the vehicle towed back the place where the ammunition was issued so that it can be safely unloaded there.|Inform emergency service responders that there is ammunition in the vehicle.|Request that the emergency service responders (e.g. Police or fire fighters) remove the ammunition.|Not inform anyone that ammunition is in the vehicle so that it remains secure.

question.name: Question 9
question.text: .22 ammunition may be transported in the POMV\u2019s
question.correctans: Only in the trunk or cargo area.
question.choices: Anywhere in the vehicle, as long as the box is not showing.|Only in the trunk or cargo area.|On the floor in the passenger compartment, as long as a passenger holds it from sliding.|Only in the glove box which must be locked at all times.

question.name: Question 10
question.correctans: Should take the most direct route from the pick-up point to the drop-off point.
question.choices: Should take the most direct route from the pick-up point to the drop-off point.|Can be parked overnight as long as warning signs are placed around the vehicle.|Should keep its hazard lights (four-way flashers) on at all times.|Should stay off 4-lane highways.
